message.content:
cs.CV, cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM 

This paper is about image captioning, which is a task in computer vision (CV). The paper proposes a method that explicitly models object interactions in semantics and geometry using Graph Convolutional Networks (GCNs) and aligns linguistic words with visual semantic units. Therefore, the paper is likely to belong to the Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition (cs.CV) sub-category. Additionally, the paper heavily relies on natural language processing (NLP) techniques to generate captions, which suggests that it could also belong to the Computation and Language (cs.CL) sub-category. The use of GCNs and attention mechanisms also suggests that the paper could belong to the Machine Learning (cs.LG) and Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) sub-categories. Finally, since the paper deals with image captioning, it could also belong to the Multimedia (cs.MM) sub-category.
